Router>en
Router#conf t
Enter configuration commands, one per line.  End with CNTL/Z.
Router(config)#int gig0/0
Router(config-if)#ip add 29.104.197.1
% Incomplete command.
Router(config-if)#ip add 29.104.197.1 255.255.255.192
Router(config-if)#no sh

Router(config-if)#
%LINK-5-CHANGED: Interface GigabitEthernet0/0, changed state to up

%LINEPROTO-5-UPDOWN: Line protocol on Interface GigabitEthernet0/0, changed state to up

Router(config-if)#




30 pc's -> 32 -> 2^5

so we have 255.255.255.11100000

192.168.0.3

11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00000011
AND
11111111.11111111.11111111.11100000 (224)
=
11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00000000


11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00000000
or
00000000.00000000.00000000.00011111
=
11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00011111 = 31

192.168.0.0-31


192.169.0.40
11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.‭00101000‬ - 40
AND
11111111.11111111.11111111.11100000
=
11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00100000 = .32


11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00100000
OR
00000000.00000000.00000000.00011111
=
11000000‬.‭10101000‬.00000000.00111111 = 63

193.168.0.32-63


100  pc's 128 2^7 = 1000 0000
subnetmask 255.255.255.128
